meanings.definition: A person who spins or twirls something.
meanings.sent1: The talented birlers at the circus amazed the audience with their spinning plates.
meanings.sent2: The birlers in the dance troupe gracefully twirled their ribbons during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The birlers at the party made the room come alive with their spinning tops.
meanings.sent4: The birlers on the playground spun like whirlwinds, creating a colorful blur.
meanings.sent5: The young birlers practiced spinning their hula hoops with great enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To spin or twirl something rapidly.
meanings.sent1: She birlers the jump rope so fast that it's a blur of motion.
meanings.sent2: The chef birlers the pizza dough expertly before placing it in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The children birlers their yo-yos with laughter and joy in the park.
meanings.sent4: The wind birlers the leaves in a whirlwind dance across the yard.
meanings.sent5: He birlers the basketball on his finger, showing off his skills to his friends.

meanings.definition: The act of spinning or twirling something.
meanings.sent1: The birlers of the colorful pinwheel caught the attention of the children.
meanings.sent2: Her birlers of the baton were flawless during the marching band performance.
meanings.sent3: The birlers of the dreidel brought joy to the family during Hanukkah.
meanings.sent4: The birlers of the carousel horses delighted the young riders at the fair.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic birlers of the fan blades created a soothing hum in the room.
